member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.Specialized.RsdDocument
member.summary: Represents a Really Simple Discovery (RSD) syndication resource.

remarks.para: This implementation conforms to the Really Simple Discovery (RSD) 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://cyber.law.harvard.edu/blogs/gems/tech/rsd.html.
The purpose of this format is to provide a way for client software find the services needed to read, edit, or communicate with web logging software.

member.name: M:Argotic.Syndication.Specialized.RsdDocument.LoadAsyncCancel
member.summary: Cancels an asynchronous operation to load this syndication resource.
member.remarks: Use the LoadAsyncCancel method to cancel a pending operation. If there is a load operation in progress, this method releases resources used to execute the load operation. If there is no load operation pending, this method does nothing.

member.summary: Private member to hold the human-readable copyright statement that applies to the feed.

member.summary: Private member to hold the URL of the RSS specification implemented by the software that created the feed.

member.summary: Private member to hold a value that credits the software that created the feed.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.ManagingEditor
member.summary: Gets or sets the e-mail address of the person to contact regarding the editorial content of this feed.
member.value: The e-mail address of the person to contact regarding the editorial content of this feed.

remarks.para: There is no requirement to follow a specific format for email addresses. Publishers can format addresses according to the RFC 2822 Address Specification, the RFC 2368 guidelines for mailto links, or some other scheme. The recommended format for e-mail addresses is username@hostname.tld (Real Name).

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.PublicationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the publication date and time of this feed's content.
member.value: A object that represents the publication date and time of this feed's content. The default value is , which indicates that no publication date was specified.
member.remarks: Publishers of daily, weekly or monthly periodicals can use this element to associate feed items with the date they most recently went to press.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.Rating
member.summary: Gets or sets an advisory label for the content in this feed.
member.value: A string value, formatted according to the specification for the Platform for Internet Content Selection (PICS), that supplies an advisory label for the content in this feed.

remarks.para: For further information on the Platform for Internet Content Selection (PICS) advisory label formatting specification, see http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-PICS-labels#General.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.SelfLink
member.summary: Gets or sets a URL that describes the feed itself.
member.value: A that represents a URL that points to where this feed can be retrieved from.

remarks.para: Identifying a feed's URL within the feed makes it more portable, self-contained, and easier to cache. For these reasons, a feed should provide a value for that is used for this purpose.
Identifying a self referential link is achieved by including a atom:link element within the channel. See RSS Profile for more information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.SkipDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the days of the week during which this feed is not updated.
member.value: A collection of enumeration values that indicate the days of the week during which this feed is not updated.
member.remarks: enumeration values within this collection must not be duplicated.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.SkipHours
member.summary: Gets or sets the hours of the day during which this feed is not updated.
member.value: A collection of objects that indicate the hours of the day during which this feed is not updated.
member.remarks: Values from 0 to 23 are permitted, with 0 representing midnight. Integer values within this collection must not be duplicated.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.TextInput

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssChannel.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of minutes to cache the data before a client should request it again.
member.value: The maximum number of minutes to cache the data before an aggregator should request it again. The default value is , which indicates no time-to-live was specified.
member.remarks: Aggregators that support this property should treat it as a publisher's suggestion of a feed's update frequency, not a hard rule.

member.name: T:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient
member.summary: Allows applications to send and received notification pings by using the Trackback peer-to-peer notification protocol.

remarks.para: This implementation of Trackback is based on the Trackback 1.2 specification which can be found at http://www.sixapart.com/pronet/docs/trackback_spec.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the TrackbackClient class.

member.summary: Private member to hold the authentication credentials utilized when making an Trackback ping request.

member.summary: Private member to hold the web proxy utilized when making an Trackback ping request.

member.summary: Gets or sets the web proxy utilized by this client to proxy Trackback pings.
member.value: A object that represents the web proxy utilized by this client to proxy Trackback pings. The default is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic), which indicates no proxy will be used to proxy the request.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient.Timeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the amount of time after which asynchronous send operations will time out.
member.value: A that specifies the time-out period. The default value is 15 seconds.
member.remarks: If is equal to , is initialized using the settings in the application or machine configuration files.
member.exception: The time out period is less than zero.
The time out period is greater than a year.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether the DefaultCredentials are sent when making Trackback pings.
member.value: true if the default credentials are used; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Some Trackback servers require that the client be authenticated before the server executes Trackback pings on its behalf. Set this property to true when this object should, if requested by the server, authenticate using the default credentials of the currently logged on user. For client applications, this is the desired behavior in most scenarios.
Credentials information can also be specified using the application and machine configuration files. For more information, see Element (Network Settings).

If the UseDefaultCredentials property is set to false, then the value set in the property will be used for the credentials when connecting to the server. If the UseDefaultCredentials property is set to false and the property has not been set, then Trackback pings are sent to the server anonymously.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient.UserAgent
member.summary: Gets or sets information such as the client application name, version, host operating system, and language.
member.value: Information such as the client application name, version, host operating system, and language. The default value is an agent that describes this syndication framework.
member.exception: The is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The is an empty string.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient.AsyncSendHasBeenCancelled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the client asynchronous send operation was cancelled.
member.value: true if client asynchronous send operation has been cancelled, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.TrackbackClient.SendOperationInProgress
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the client is in the process of sending an Trackback ping request.
member.value: true if client is in the process of sending an Trackback ping request, otherwise false.

This stuff will change over time and are added with a certain degree of confidence that may have a decay in certain applications. For this reason it is important to keep a track of when things were added/modified.

member.name: M:Argotic.Configuration.Provider.SyndicationResourceProvider.GetResources(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a collection of all the resources in the data source in pages of data.
member.param: The index of the page of results to return. is zero-based.
The size of the page of results to return.
The total number of matched resources.
member.returns: A that contains a page of objects with a size of , beginning at the page specified by .

remarks.para: returns a list of all of the resources from the data source for the configured property. Syndication resources are returned in order of last time they were updated in the data source.

The results returned by are constrained by the and parameters. The parameter identifies the number of objects to return in the collection. The parameter identifies which page of results to return, where 0 identifies the first page. The parameter is an out parameter that is set to the total number of syndication resources in the data source.
For example, if there are 13 resources in the data source, and the value was 1 with a of 5, then the would contain the sixth through the tenth resources returned. The parameter would be set to 13.

member.name: P:Argotic.Configuration.Provider.SyndicationResourceProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application using the custom syndication resource provider.
member.value: The name of the application using the custom syndication resource provider.

remarks.para: The property value is stored in the data source with related syndication resource information to associate a resource with a particular application.

Because syndication resource providers store resource information uniquely for each application, multiple applications can use the same data source without running into a conflict if duplicate syndication resources are created. Alternatively, multiple applications can use the same syndication resource data source by specifying the same .
In your syndication resource provider implementation, you will need to ensure that your data schema includes the and that data source queries and updates also include the .

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.RssGuid
member.summary: Represents a means of uniquely identifying a .

remarks.para: A publisher should provide a guid with each item.

A enables an aggregator to detect when an item has been received previously and does not need to be presented to a user again. If the guid's property has a value of true, the guid's value must be the permanent URL of the web page associated with the item. Otherwise the guid may employ any syntax the feed's publisher has devised for ensuring the uniqueness of the string.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the RssGuid class.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.Specialized.ApmlDocument
member.summary: Represents a Attention Profiling Markup Language (APML) syndication resource.

remarks.para: This implementation conforms to the Attention Profiling Markup Language (APML) 0.6 specification, which can be found at http://apml.pbwiki.com.
The purpose of this format is to provide an open standard that encapsulates a summary of your interests (across multiple profiles) in a simple, portable way.

member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used when creating an explicit concept. Explicit data is for items that are explicitly added by a user to represent something. For example, a user could edit their own APML file and add items they know they're interested in. For this reason the and properties are not necessary for explicit data items, because it's a manual process.

A object that indicates the last time this concept was updated.
member.remarks: This constructor is meant to be used when creating an implicit concept. Implicit data is added by machines/computers that try to make some informed guesses about the things that you are interested in. This stuff will change over time and are added with a certain degree of confidence that may have a decay in certain applications. For this reason it is important to keep a track of when things were added/modified.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.AtomFeed
member.summary: Represents an Atom syndication feed, including metadata about the feed, and some or all of the entries associated with it.

remarks.para: Atom is an an XML-based Web content and metadata syndication format that describes lists of related information known as feeds. Feeds are composed of a number of items, known as entries, each with an extensible set of attached metadata.
This implementation conforms to the Atom 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://www.atomenabled.org/developers/syndication/atom-format-spec.php.

If multiple objects with the same value appear in an Atom Feed Document, they represent the same entry. Their timestamps should be different. If an Atom Feed Document contains multiple entries with the same , Atom Processors may choose to display all of them or some subset of them. One typical behavior would be to display only the entry with the latest timestamp.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry
member.summary: Represents exactly one Atom entry, outside of the context of an Atom feed.

remarks.para: Atom is an an XML-based Web content and metadata syndication format that describes lists of related information known as feeds. Feeds are composed of a number of items, known as entries, each with an extensible set of attached metadata.
This implementation conforms to the Atom 1.0 specification, which can be found at http://www.atomenabled.org/developers/syndication/atom-format-spec.php.

Experience teaches that feeds that contain textual content are in general more useful than those that do not. Some applications (one example is full-text indexers) require a minimum amount of text or (X)HTML to function reliably and predictably. Feed producers should be aware of these issues. It is advisable that each object contain a non-empty , a non-empty when content is defined, and a non-empty when the entry contains does not provide a . However, the absence of is not an error, and Atom Processors must not fail to function correctly as a consequence of such an absence.

member.summary: Gets or sets the base URI other than the base URI of the document or external entity.

member.summary: Gets the that this syndication resource implements.
member.value: The enumeration value that indicates the type of syndication format that this syndication resource implements.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets a permanent, universally unique identifier for this entry.
member.value: A object that represents a permanent, universally unique identifier for this entry.

remarks.para: When an Atom Document is relocated, migrated, syndicated, republished, exported, or imported, the content of its universally unique identifier must not change. Put another way, an pertains to all instantiations of a particular ; revisions retain the same content in their properties. It is suggested that the be stored along with the associated resource.

member.exception: The is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Links
member.summary: Gets or sets references from this entry to one or more Web resources.
member.value: A collection of objects that represent references from this entry to one or more Web resources.

remarks.para: An entry must not contain more than one with a property of alternate that has the same combination of and property values.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.PublishedOn
member.summary: Gets or sets a date-time indicating an instant in time associated with an event early in the life cycle of this entry.
member.value: A that indicates an instant in time associated with an event early in the life cycle of this entry. The default value is , which indicates that no publication time was provided.
member.remarks: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Rights
member.summary: Gets or sets information about rights held in and over this entry.
member.value: A object that represents information about rights held in and over this entry.
member.remarks: The property should not be used to convey machine-readable licensing information. If an does not provide any rights information, then the of the containing feed, if present, is considered to apply to the entry.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the meta-data of the source feed that this entry was copied from.
member.value: A object that represents the meta-data of the source feed that this entry was copied from.

remarks.para: The is designed to allow the aggregation of entries from different feeds while retaining information about an entry's source feed. For this reason, Atom Processors that are performing such aggregation should include at least the required feed-level meta-data elements (id, title, and updated) in the .

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Summary
member.summary: Gets or sets information that conveys a short summary, abstract, or excerpt for this entry.
member.value: A object that represents information that conveys a short summary, abstract, or excerpt for this entry.

remarks.para: It is not advisable for the property to duplicate or because Atom Processors might assume there is a useful summary when there is none.

Entries must contain a in either of the following cases:
The contains an property that has a property (and is thus empty).
The contains content that is encoded in Base64; i.e., the property of property is a MIME media type, but is not an XML media type, does not begin with text/, and does not end with /xml or +xml.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomEntry.Title

member.value: A that indicates the most recent instant in time when this entry was modified in a way the publisher considers significant. Publishers may change the value of this element over time. The default value is , which indicates that no update time was provided.
member.remarks: The should be provided in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.Specialized.BlogMLTextConstruct.EscapeContent
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the content of this text is escaped using a CDATA block.
member.value: true if the content of this text will be escaped using a CDATA block section; otherwise false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: CDATA sections are used to escape blocks of text containing characters which would otherwise be recognized as markup. All tags and entity references are ignored by an XML processor that treats them just like any character data. CDATA blocks should be used when you want to include large blocks of special characters as character data, but you do not want to have to use entity references all the time.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.AtomId
member.summary: Represents a permanent, universally unique identifier for an or .

remarks.para: When an Atom Document is relocated, migrated, syndicated, republished, exported, or imported, the content of its universally unique identifier must not change. Put another way, an pertains to all instantiations of a particular or ; revisions retain the same content in their properties. It is suggested that the be stored along with the associated resource.

The content of an must be created in a way that assures uniqueness. Because of the risk of confusion between IRIs that would be equivalent if they were mapped to URIs and dereferenced, the following normalization strategy should be applied when generating unique identifiers:
Provide the scheme in lowercase characters.
Provide the host, if any, in lowercase characters.
Only perform percent-encoding where it is essential.
Use uppercase A through F characters when percent-encoding.
Prevent dot-segments from appearing in paths.
For schemes that define a default authority, use an empty authority if the default is desired.
For schemes that define an empty path to be equivalent to a path of "/", use "/".
For schemes that define a port, use an empty port if the default is desired.
Preserve empty fragment identifiers and queries.
Ensure that all components of the IRI are appropriately character normalized, e.g., by using NFC or NFKC.

Instances of objects can be compared to determine whether an entry or feed is the same as one seen before. Processors must compare objects on a character-by-character basis (in a case-sensitive fashion). Comparison operations must be based solely on the IRI character strings and must not rely on dereferencing the IRIs or URIs mapped from them.

remarks.para: returns a list of all of the resources from the data source for the configured property. Syndication resources are returned in order of last time they were updated in the data source.

The results returned by are constrained by the and parameters. The parameter identifies the number of objects to return in the collection. The parameter identifies which page of results to return, where 0 identifies the first page. The parameter is an out parameter that is set to the total number of syndication resources in the data source.
For example, if there are 13 resources in the data source, and the value was 1 with a of 5, then the would contain the sixth through the tenth resources returned. The parameter would be set to 13.

member.summary: Initializes the provider.

A collection of the name/value pairs representing the provider-specific attributes specified in the configuration for this provider.
member.remarks: The base class implementation internally tracks the number of times the provider's Initialize method has been called. If a provider is initialized more than once, an is thrown stating that the provider is already initialized. Because most feature providers call Initialize prior to performing provider-specific initialization, this method is a central location for preventing double initialization.

member.name: P:Argotic.Configuration.Provider.XmlSyndicationResourceProvider.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application using the XML syndication resource provider.
member.value: The name of the application using the XML syndication resource provider.

remarks.para: The property value is stored in the data source with related syndication resource information to associate a resource with a particular application.

Because syndication resource providers store resource information uniquely for each application, multiple applications can use the same data source without running into a conflict if duplicate syndication resources are created. Alternatively, multiple applications can use the same syndication resource data source by specifying the same .

member.summary: Represents a Web Log Markup Language (BlogML) syndication resource.

remarks.para: This implementation conforms to the BlogML 2.0 specification, which can be found at http://blogml.org.
The purpose of this format is to provide an open format derived from XML to store and restore the content of a blog.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Author
member.summary: Gets or sets the e-mail address of the person who wrote this item.
member.value: The e-mail address of the person who wrote this item.

remarks.para: There is no requirement to follow a specific format for email addresses. Publishers can format addresses according to the RFC 2822 Address Specification, the RFC 2368 guidelines for mailto links, or some other scheme. The recommended format for e-mail addresses is username@hostname.tld (Real Name).
A feed published by an individual should omit the item author and use the or channel properties to provide contact information.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Categories
member.summary: Gets the categories or tags to which this item belongs.
member.value: A of objects that represent the categories to which this item belongs. The default value is an empty collection.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Comments
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of a web page that contains comments received in response to this item.
member.value: A that represents the URL of a web page that contains comments received in response to this item.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Description
member.summary: Gets or sets character data that contains this item's full content or a summary of its contents.
member.value: Character data that contains this item's full content or a summary of its contents.

remarks.para: The description may be empty if the item specifies a .
The description must be suitable for presentation as HTML. HTML markup must be encoded as character data either by employing the HTML entities (< and >) or a CDATA section.

The description should not contain relative URLs, because the RSS format does not provide a means to identify the base URL of a document. When a relative URL is present, an aggregator may attempt to resolve it to a full URL using the channel's link as the base.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Enclosures
member.summary: Gets the media objects associated with this item.
member.value: A of objects that represent the media objects such as an audio, video, or executable file that are associated with this item. The default value is an empty collection.

remarks.para: Support for the enclosure element in RSS software varies significantly because of disagreement over whether the specification permits more than one enclosure per item. Although the original author intended to permit no more than one enclosure in each item, this limit is not explicit in the specification. For best support in the widest number of aggregators, an item should not contain more than one enclosure.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Guid
member.summary: Gets or sets the unique identifier for this item.
member.value: A object that represents the unique identifier for this item. The default value is a null reference.
member.remarks: A publisher should provide a guid for each item.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Link
member.summary: Gets or sets the URL of a web page associated with this item.
member.value: A that represents the URL of a web page associated with this item.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.PublicationDate
member.summary: Gets or sets the publication date and time of this item.
member.value: A object that represents the publication date and time of this item. The default value is , which indicates that no publication date was specified.
member.remarks: The specification recommends that aggregators should ignore items with a publication date that occurs in the future, providing a means for publishers to embargo an item until that date. However, it is recommended that publishers should not include items in a feed until they are ready for publication.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets the source feed that this item was republished from.
member.value: A object that represents the source feed that this item was republished from. The default value is a null reference.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssItem.Title
member.summary: Gets or sets character data that provides this item's headline.
member.value: Character data that provides this item's headline.
member.remarks: This property is optional if the item contains a .

remarks.para:
The Atom specification defines five initial values for the Registry of Link Relations:
alternate: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies an alternate version of the resource described by the containing element.
related: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource related to the resource described by the containing element.
self: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource equivalent to the containing element.
enclosure: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a related resource that is potentially large in size and might require special handling.
via: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource that is the source of the information provided in the containing element.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomLink.Relation
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the link relation type of this Web resource.
member.value: A value that indicates the link relation type.

remarks.para: If the property is not specified, the must be interpreted as if the link relation type is alternate.

The value of the property must be a string that is non-empty and matches either the isegment-nz-nc or the IRI production in RFC 3987: Internationalized Resource Identifiers (IRIs). Note that use of a relative reference other than a simple name is not allowed. If a name is given, implementations must consider the link relation type equivalent to the same name registered within the IANA Registry of Link Relations (Section 7), and thus to the IRI that would be obtained by appending the value of the rel attribute to the string "http://www.iana.org/assignments/relation/". The value of property describes the meaning of the link, but does not impose any behavioral requirements on Atom Processors.

The Atom specification defines five initial values for the Registry of Link Relations:
alternate: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies an alternate version of the resource described by the containing element.
related: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource related to the resource described by the containing element.
self: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource equivalent to the containing element.
enclosure: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a related resource that is potentially large in size and might require special handling.
via: Signifies that the IRI in the value of the property identifies a resource that is the source of the information provided in the containing element.

member.summary: Gets or sets human-readable information about this Web resource.
member.value: Human-readable information about this Web resource.
member.remarks: The property is language-sensitive, with the natural language of the value being specified by the property. Entities represent their corresponding characters, not markup.

member.name: T:Argotic.Net.XmlRpcClient
member.summary: Allows applications to send remote procedure calls by using the Extensible Markup Language Remote Procedure Call (XML-RPC) protocol.

remarks.para: This implementation of XML-RPC is based on the XML-RPC 1.0 specification which can be found at http://www.xmlrpc.com/spec.
XML-RPC is a Remote Procedure Calling protocol that works over the Internet.
An XML-RPC message is an HTTP-POST request. The body of the request is in XML. A procedure executes on the server and the value it returns is also formatted in XML.
Procedure parameters can be scalars, numbers, strings, dates and other simple types; and can also be complex record and list structures.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the XmlRpcClient class.

member.name: P:Argotic.Net.XmlRpcClient.UseDefaultCredentials
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether the DefaultCredentials are sent when making remote procedure calls.
member.value: true if the default credentials are used; otherwise false. The default value is false.

remarks.para: Some XML-RPC servers require that the client be authenticated before the server executes remote procedures on its behalf. Set this property to true when this object should, if requested by the server, authenticate using the default credentials of the currently logged on user. For client applications, this is the desired behavior in most scenarios.
Credentials information can also be specified using the application and machine configuration files. For more information, see Element (Network Settings).

If the UseDefaultCredentials property is set to false, then the value set in the property will be used for the credentials when connecting to the server. If the UseDefaultCredentials property is set to false and the property has not been set, then remote procedure calls are sent to the server anonymously.

member.name: M:Argotic.Syndication.SyndicationManager.GetResources(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Gets a collection of all the resources in the data source in pages of data.
member.param: The index of the page of results to return. is zero-based.
The size of the page of results to return.
The total number of matched resources.
member.returns: A that contains a page of objects with a size of , beginning at the page specified by .

remarks.para: returns a list of all of the resources from the data source for the configured property. Syndication resources are returned in order of last time they were updated in the data source.

The results returned by are constrained by the and parameters. The parameter identifies the number of objects to return in the collection. The parameter identifies which page of results to return, where 0 identifies the first page. The parameter is an out parameter that is set to the total number of syndication resources in the data source.
For example, if there are 13 resources in the data source, and the value was 1 with a of 5, then the would contain the sixth through the tenth resources returned. The parameter would be set to 13.

member.exception: The is less than zero.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.SyndicationManager.ApplicationName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the application.
member.value: The name of the application.
member.remarks: The is used to identify users specific to an application. That is, the same syndication resource can exist in the data store for multiple applications that specify a different . This enables multiple applications to use the same data store to store resource information without running into duplicate syndication resource conflicts. Alternatively, multiple applications can use the same syndication resource data store by specifying the same . The can be set programmatically or declaratively in the configuration for the application.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.SyndicationManager.Provider
member.summary: Gets a reference to the default syndication resource provider for the application.
member.value: The default syndication resource provider for the application exposed using the abstract base class.
member.remarks: The property enables you to reference the default syndication resource provider for an application directly. This is commonly used to access custom members of the syndication resource provider that are not part of the abstract base class.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.SyndicationManager.Providers
member.summary: Gets a collection of the syndication resource providers for the application.
member.value: A of the syndication resource providers configured for the application.
member.remarks: The property references all of the syndication resource providers enabled for an application, including providers added in the Web.config file for ASP.NET applications, the App.config for client applications, and the Machine.config file for all applications.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.Specialized.BlogMLAttachment
member.summary: Represents a post attachment.
member.remarks: An attachment can be any document (image, video) related to a blog post. The attachment can be lazily stored as an URL or fully embedded in the body of the post by base64 encoding. In both cases, the URL must be specified so that the implementor can figure out where to dump the attachment to.

For example, a user could edit their own APML file and add items they know they're interested in. For this reason the and properties are not necessary for explicit data items, because it's a manual process.

Implicit data is added by machines/computers that try to make some informed guesses about the things that you are interested in. This stuff will change over time and are added with a certain degree of confidence that may have a decay in certain applications. For this reason it is important to keep a track of when things were added/modified.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.RssFeed
member.summary: Represents a Really Simple Syndication (RSS) syndication feed.

remarks.para: This implementation conforms to the RSS 2.0.10 specification, which can be found at http://www.rssboard.org/rss-specification.
This implementation also conforms to the RSS Best Practices Profile guidelines as close as possible, which can be found at http://www.rssboard.org/rss-profile.

member.name: M:Argotic.Syndication.OpmlOutline.CreateInclusionOutline(System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new that represents an inclusion outline using the supplied parameters.
member.param: The textual content of the outline.
A that represents an http address.
member.returns: A new object that represents an inclusion outline, initialized using the supplied parameters.

remarks.para: When a outline is expanded in an outliner, if the ends with .opml, the outline expands in place. This is called inclusion.
If the does not end with .opml, the link is assumed to point to something that can be displayed in a web browser.
The difference between link and include is that link may point to something that is displayed in a web browser, and include always points to an OPML file.
This method will create an with a of include if the ends with .opml, otherwise the will have a value of link.

member.exception: The is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).
The is an empty string.
The is a null reference (Nothing in Visual Basic).

member.name: M:Argotic.Syndication.OpmlOutline.CreateSubscriptionListOutline(System.String,System.String,System.Uri)
member.summary: Creates a new that represents a subscription list outline using the supplied parameters.
member.param: The textual content of the outline.
The syndication format of the feed being pointed to. Permissible values include rss or feed.
A that represents the http address of the feed.
member.returns: A new object that represents a subscription list outline, initialized using the supplied parameters.

remarks.para: A subscription list is a possibly multiple-level list of subscriptions to feeds. Each sub-element of the body of the OPML document is a node of type rss or an outline element that contains nodes of type rss.

Today, most subscription lists are a flat sequence of rss nodes, but some aggregators allow categorized subscription lists that are arbitrarily structured. A validator may flag these files, warning that some processors may not understand and preserve the structure.

The version of the syndication format for the feed that's being pointed to. Permissible values include RSS, RSS1, scriptingNews, or a custom version identifier for the feed. This value can be an empty string.
The title of the feed. This value can be an empty string.
The description of the feed. This value can be an empty string.
A that represents the natural or formal language in which the feed is written. This value can be null.
member.returns: A new object that represents a subscription list outline, initialized using the supplied parameters.

remarks.para: A subscription list is a possibly multiple-level list of subscriptions to feeds. Each sub-element of the body of the OPML document is a node of type rss or an outline element that contains nodes of type rss.

Today, most subscription lists are a flat sequence of rss nodes, but some aggregators allow categorized subscription lists that are arbitrarily structured. A validator may flag these files, warning that some processors may not understand and preserve the structure.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.OpmlDocument
member.summary: Represents a Outline Processor Markup Language (OPML) syndication resource.

remarks.para: This implementation conforms to the OPML 2.0 specification, which can be found at http://www.opml.org/spec2.
The purpose of this format is to provide a way to exchange information between outliners and Internet services that can be browsed or controlled through an outliner.
OPML is also the file format for an outliner application, which is why OPML files may contain information about the size, position and expansion state of the window the outline is displayed in.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.AtomSource
member.summary: Represents the meta-data of the source feed that an was copied from.

remarks.para: If an is copied from one feed into another feed, then the source feed's metadata (all child elements of feed other than the entry elements) may be preserved within the copied entry by specifying an , if it is not already present in the entry, and including some or all of the source feed's meta-data elements as the source's children. Such metadata should be preserved if the source feed contains any of the child elements author, contributor, rights, or category and those child elements are not present in the source entry.

The is designed to allow the aggregation of entries from different feeds while retaining information about an entry's source feed. For this reason, Atom Processors that are performing such aggregation should include at least the required feed-level meta-data elements (id, title, and updated) in the .

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.AtomContent
member.summary: Represents information that contains or links to the content of an .

remarks.para:
Atom Documents must conform to the following processing model rules. Atom Processors must interpret according to the first applicable rule.
If the value of the property is text, the value of the property must not contain child elements. Such text is intended to be presented to humans in a readable fashion. Thus, Atom Processors may collapse white space (including line breaks), and display the text using typographic techniques such as justification and proportional fonts.
If the value of the property is html, the value of the property must not contain child elements and should be suitable for handling as HTML. The HTML markup must be escaped. The HTML markup should be such that it could validly appear directly within an HTML div element. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it.
If the value of the property is xhtml, the the value of the property must be a single XHTML div element and should be suitable for handling as XHTML. The XHTML div element itself must not be considered part of the content. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it. The escaped versions of characters represent those characters, not markup.
If the value is an XML media type or ends with +xml or /xml (case insensitive), the content may include child elements and should be suitable for handling as the indicated media type. If the is not provided, this would normally mean that the would contain a single child element that would serve as the root element of the XML document of the indicated type.
If the value begins with text/ (case insensitive), the must not contain child elements.
For all other values , the must be a valid Base64 encoding, as described in RFC 3548: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, section 3. When decoded, it should be suitable for handling as the indicated media type. In this case, the characters in the Base64 encoding may be preceded and followed in the atom:content element by white space, and lines are separated by a single newline (U+000A) character.

member.name: M:Argotic.Syndication.AtomContent.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the supplied content and entity encoding.
member.param: The local content of the entry.
A value indicating the entity encoding of the content.

remarks.para:
The Atom specification defines three initial values for the type of entry content:
html: The content must not contain child elements and should be suitable for handling as HTML. The HTML markup must be escaped, and should be such that it could validly appear directly within an HTML div element. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it.
text: The content must not contain child elements. Such text is intended to be presented to humans in a readable fashion.
xhtml: The content must be a single XHTML div element and should be suitable for handling as XHTML. The XHTML div element itself must not be considered part of the content. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it. The escaped versions of characters represent those characters, not markup.

member.summary: Gets or sets the local content of this entry.
member.value: The local content of this entry.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomContent.ContentType
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the entity encoding of this content.
member.value: A value indicating the entity encoding of this content.

remarks.para:
The Atom specification defines three initial values for the type of entry content:
html: The content must not contain child elements and should be suitable for handling as HTML. The HTML markup must be escaped, and should be such that it could validly appear directly within an HTML div element. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it.
text: The content must not contain child elements. Such text is intended to be presented to humans in a readable fashion.
xhtml: The content must be a single XHTML div element and should be suitable for handling as XHTML. The XHTML div element itself must not be considered part of the content. Atom Processors that display the content may use the markup to aid in displaying it. The escaped versions of characters represent those characters, not markup.

If the value is an XML media type or ends with +xml or /xml (case insensitive), the content may include child elements and should be suitable for handling as the indicated media type. If the is not provided, this would normally mean that the would contain a single child element that would serve as the root element of the XML document of the indicated type.

If the content type is not one of those specified above, it must conform to the syntax of a MIME media type, but must not be a composite type. See RFC 4288: Media Type Specifications and Registration Procedures for more details.
If the value begins with text/ (case insensitive), the must not contain child elements.

For all other values , the must be a valid Base64 encoding, as described in RFC 3548: The Base16, Base32, and Base64 Data Encodings, section 3. When decoded, it should be suitable for handling as the indicated media type. In this case, the characters in the Base64 encoding may be preceded and followed in the atom:content element by white space, and lines are separated by a single newline (U+000A) character.
If neither the nor the is provided, Atom Processors must behave as though the property has a value of text.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.AtomContent.Source
member.summary: Gets or sets an IRI that identifies the remote location of this content.
member.value: A that represents a Internationalized Resource Identifier (IRI) that identifies the remote location of this content.

remarks.para: If a property is specified, the property must be empty. Atom Processors may use the IRI to retrieve the content and may choose to ignore remote content or to present it in a different manner than local content.

If a property is specified, the should be provided and must be a MIME media type, rather than text, html, or xhtml. The value is advisory; that is to say, when the corresponding URI (mapped from an IRI, if necessary) is dereferenced, if the server providing that content also provides a media type, the server-provided media type is authoritative.
See RFC 3987: Internationalized Resource Identifiers for the IRI technical specification.
See System.Uri for enabling support for IRIs within Microsoft .NET framework applications.

member.name: T:Argotic.Syndication.RssEnclosure
member.summary: Represents a media object such as an audio, video, or executable file that can be associated with an .

remarks.para: Support for the enclosure element in RSS software varies significantly because of disagreement over whether the specification permits more than one enclosure per item. Although the original author intended to permit no more than one enclosure in each item, this limit is not explicit in the specification. For best support in the widest number of aggregators, an item should not contain more than one enclosure.

code.title: The following code example demonstrates the usage of the RssEnclosure class.

member.name: P:Argotic.Syndication.RssEnclosure.Length
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the media object.
member.value: The size, in bytes, of the media object. The default value is , which indicates that no size was specified.

remarks.para: Though an enclosure must specify its size with the length attribute, the size of some media objects cannot be determined by an RSS publisher. When an enclosure's size cannot be determined, a publisher should use a length of 0.

The peer-to-peer file-sharing protocol BitTorrent deploys files using a small key file called a torrent that tells a client how to find and download the file. When an enclosure is delivered in a multi-step process like the one used by BitTorrent, the length should be the size of the first file that must be downloaded to begin the process.

member.exception: The is less than zero.
